lead_paragraph: A new report suggesting partners at the world's top private equity funds have reaped more than $10 billion in management fees over the last 15 years -- three quarters of their total haul -- may add more fuel to the debate on the industry's fee models.
snippet: A new report suggesting partners at the world's top private equity fund have reaped more than $10 billion in management fees over the last 15 years -- three quarters of their total haul -- may add more fuel to the debate on the industry's fee models.

headline.main: Private Equity Firms Reap Big Fees, Report Says

abstract: A new report suggesting partners at the world's top private equity fund have reaped more than $10 billion in management fees over the last 15 years -- three quarters of their total haul -- may add more fuel to the debate on the industry's fee models.
